title: Greek-English (1879) Septuagint Old Testament
description:
The 1879 Greek-English edition of the Septuagint Old Testament, translated by Lancelot Charles Lee Brenton, is a significant work in biblical studies. Brenton's translation of the Septuagint, which was first released in 1844, stands as the second English translation of this crucial ancient Greek version of the Old Testament.

This edition is noteworthy for pairing the Greek text of the Septuagint with its English translation, offering valuable insights for comparative study and understanding of the texts. Additionally, Brenton's work includes various readings and critical notes, providing a deeper scholarly context for the translation. Over the century and a half since its first release, Brenton's translation of the Septuagint has seen several reprints and formats, attesting to its enduring importance and utility in biblical scholarship.

The Septuagint, a translation of the Hebrew Bible into Greek, is particularly significant as it was widely used in the Hellenistic Jewish community and by early Christians, influencing the development of Christian theology. Brenton's translation has played a crucial role in making this seminal text accessible to English-speaking audiences, thereby contributing significantly to the study of biblical history and interpretation.
